file_name: IntegrityFunds_20200121_485BPOS_EX-99.E UNDR CONTR_11948727_EX-99.E UNDR CONTR_Service Agreement.txt

perturbation.original_text: In consideration of the services rendered pursuant to this Agreement, Integrity shall receive the excess, if any, of the sales price, as set forth in the Fund's Registration Statement, over the net asset value of Shares sold by Integrity, as underwriter. The Fund shall also pay Integrity any distribution and/or service fees applicable to the Shares as authorized by the Shareholder Services Plan (the "Plan") adopted by the Fund under Rule 12b-1 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 and set forth in the Fund's Registration Statement. Such fees shall be payable in the manner and terms set forth in the Plan.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration of the services rendered pursuant to this Agreement, Integrity shall receive the excess, if any, of the sales price, as set forth in the Fund's Registration Statement, over the net asset value of Shares sold by Integrity, as underwriter. The Fund may also offer Integrity additional compensation as determined by the Compensation Schedule (the "Schedule") set forth by the fund manager. The specifics of additional compensation will be at the discretion of the fund manager.
perturbation.explanation: The original text guarantees payment of fees according to the Shareholder Services Plan. The modified text replaces 'distribution and/or service fees' with 'additional compensation' and makes it subject to the fund manager's discretion, contradicting the original guaranteed payment structure. This also introduces uncertainty to compensation amounts which were originally set by the Shareholder Services Plan.

perturbation.original_text: All activities by Integrity as underwriter of the Shares shall comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, including, without limitation, all rules and regulations made or adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") or by any securities association registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Fund's Registration Statement.
perturbation.changed_text: All activities by Integrity as underwriter of the Shares should generally align with relevant governmental guidelines and corporate governance practices.
perturbation.explanation: The original text enforces a strict adherence to applicable laws, rules and regulations, including those of the SEC. The modified text replaces this with 'should generally align,' weakening the obligation and potentially conflicting with mandatory regulatory compliance. This also creates ambiguity by not specifying which governmental guidelines and corporate governance practices apply.

perturbation.original_text: The Fund agrees to advise Integrity immediately in writing: (a) of any request by the SEC for amendments to the registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information then in effect or for additional information; (b) in the event of the issuance by the SEC of any stop order suspending the effectiveness of the registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information then in effect or the initiation of any proceeding for that purpose; (c) of the happening of any event that makes untrue any statement of a material fact made in the registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information then in effect or that requires the making of a change in such registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information in order to make the statement therein not misleading; and (d) of all actions of the SEC with respect to any amendment to any registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information which may from time to time be filed with the SEC.
perturbation.changed_text: The Fund may, at its discretion, inform Integrity of communications with governmental bodies and of potential regulatory changes.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates immediate written notification from the Fund to Integrity regarding SEC requests, stop orders, and any events affecting the accuracy of the registration statement. The modified text changes this to a discretionary act, replacing 'agrees to advise immediately in writing' with 'may, at its discretion, inform'. This introduces a significant conflict, as Integrity may be left uninformed of critical regulatory matters, increasing risks and contradicting the original obligation.
